Here’s my suggestion. Try marinading the freeze dried steak in a vacuum container for a couple of days. Then vacuum seal the steak in a pouch/bag and submerge in water and cook to 130-135 degrees for 2 hours minimum. Remove from the bag and sear over hot charcoal for about 90 seconds per side. Since I’ve never tried it with freeze dried steak, try poking holes in part of it with a fork before marinating. It might restore it.

You could give it a fair shot at rehydration by brining it before freeze-drying. Then vaccuum-rehydrate it. Pull a maximum vaccuum on the freeze-dried piece, then introduce water instead of air into the vaccuum chamber so the water gets forced into the meat by both regular pressure and osmotic pressure (from the salt in the brine). Do it little by little so it doesn't leech out the flavor
